result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio L Mendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.
Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with Family Court and child support orders.  No contact, directly or indirectly, with victim.  No contact with anyone under age 18 unless written permission of parent or guardian is obtained.  Must comply with requirements of Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights have been restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.

timeConds.notes: Huber for employment.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.
